III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation For the past 3 days, a staff member has antagonized Youth A by
getting in the youth's face and speaking inappropriately. Staff
member does like youth's sexual orientation.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/04/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I interviewed the Complainant via telephone on 04/05/2024. No
additional information was provided.
I interviewed Youth A’s JJ Worker via telephone on 04/05/2024.
JJ Worker reported Youth A has been at the agency for three
months. She meets with Youth A monthly and has never reported
any concerns regarding staff. She was notified of the incidents
involving Youth A assaulting staff and being restrained. She said
Youth A is easily triggered and can be very aggressive.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A was biologically
born a male and prefers she/her pronouns and identify’ s as
female. Youth A has been at the agency for three months. Youth
A had a court hearing this morning and was ordered to return to
JDC, due to the incident where she assaulted staff. Youth A said
she like’s all the staff except Staff 4. She does not like Staff 4
because Staff 4 talks down to her and called her “gay”. Youth A
would not provide specific details about who witnessed this or
when Staff 4 called her gay and if anyone witnessed Staff 4 talking
about Youth A’s sexuality. Youth A said she is going to miss the
2

staff at the agency because they treat her better than her own
family.
I interviewed Chief Administrator at the agency on 04/06/2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Chief Administrator
denied any staff member has spoken inappropriately or
antagonized Youth A. Chief Administrator reported staff have
been very accommodating to Youth A by getting her nail polish
and lip gloss. He is not aware of any incident involving staff
speaking inappropriately to Youth A. Chief Administrator said
Youth A has made inappropriate remarks about staff member’s
private parts.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 04/06/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is the director and has been
working with the agency for 5 years but has been at the current
location for two months. Staff 1 denied witnessing or hearing
Youth A say Staff 4 gets in her face and speaks inappropriately
about her sexuality. She said all the staff have been very
accommodating to Youth A in reference to her preferred sexuality.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the agency on 04/06/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a coach counselor and has
been working at the agency for 5 months. Staff 2 denied
witnessing Staff 4 or any other staff calling Youth A “gay” or
speaking inappropriately to her.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the agency on 04/06/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 denied hearing Staff 4 or any other
staff calling Youth A “gay” or speaking to Youth A inappropriately.
I interviewed Staff 4 at the agency on 04/06/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 is a supervisor and has been
working at the agency for 5 months. Staff 4 denied calling Youth A
“gay”, speaking inappropriately to Youth A, or making any
references to Youth A’s preferred sexuality. Staff 4 said Youth A
has spoken inappropriately to staff about their sexuality and their
private parts.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist on
02/22/2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
3

Documents reviewed:
• Personnel file for Staff 4 was reviewed and there is no
disciplinary action noted.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted there is insufficient evidence to
support the allegations that staff antagonized or spoke
inappropriately to Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Secure juvenile justice facilities, mechanical restraint;
Title policies and procedures; prohibitions.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4161
Section (6) In the event a mechanical restraint occurs, it must be
Description performed in a manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate
to the severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A becomes aggressive after being triggered, resulting in
being restrained and shackled. While shackled, staff are hitting
Youth A with a closed fist in his stomach area and choking him to
put him in restraints. This is done out of camera view. Youth A
currently has a black left eye, scratches around their throat, and
black marks on their arms where the cuffs were.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A admitted she was
escalated and assaulted staff on 02/28/2024. She said Staff 1 was
walking with her in the hallway to help her calm down and she
reached up and tried to remove a camera. She said Staff 1 tried to
redirect her and this triggered her. She said she hit and punched
Staff 1 and several staff members came and put her in a restraint.
She said they put handcuffs on her hands and her legs. Youth A
denied she had a black eye or scratches on her throat. Youth A
said she had some marks on her wrist from the handcuffs. Youth
A said she zones out when she is triggered and therefore, cannot
remember everything. She denied being injured during the
restraint. Youth A was laughing and making jokes throughout the
interview.
4

Chief Administrator was interviewed at the agency on
04/06/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Chief
Administrator reported Youth A was restrained on 02/28/2024 and
on 02/29/2024. On 02/28/2024 Youth A was escalated, and Staff 1
was walking with Youth A through the hallway trying to calm her
down. Youth A reached up and turned the camera. Staff 1
attempted to redirect Youth A, and that’s when Youth A attacked
Staff 1. A code blue was called, and Chief Administrator and
several staff responded to assist. He said Youth A punched, bit,
grabbed a staff’s butt and penis, and pulled Staff’s 3 hair. Youth A
was put in a mechanical restraint to protect staff and get Youth A
under control. He and Staff 1 sat with Youth A in her room
afterwards and debriefed. Youth A did not report having any
injuries and didn’t want to be examined by the nurse. On
02/29/2024, Youth A was in the hallway with Staff 3 and Staff 4.
Youth A grabbed Staff 3 by the hair and punched Staff 4. A code
blue was called, Chief Administrator responded and assisted with
attempting to put Youth A in a restraint and was hit in the back of
the head and bitten by Youth A. Youth A was put in handcuffs and
taken to her room to manage her safely. Youth A has criminal
charges pending due to assaulting staff. Youth A had a court
hearing this morning and the judge ordered Youth A be placed at
JDC due to the assault against staff. Youth A will be transported to
JDC this afternoon. Administrator reported the incidents occurred
in the hallway and Youth A had tampered with the cameras, so
there is no video footage of both incidents. Youth A is over 6 feet
tall and can reach the cameras that hang from the ceiling.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is the director, has
been working with the agency for 5 years, and has been at the
current location for two months. Staff 1 reported on 02/28/2024,
Youth A refused to participate in groups, so she was walking with
her in the hallway. Youth A started to tamper with the cameras.
She redirected Youth A away, but she refused to listen. Youth A
became very combative, pushing and hitting her on her back.
Chief Administrator and several staff came to try to deescalate
Youth A. Youth A attacked staff by biting, head butting, and
punching staff. At one point Youth A licked Staff 1’s arm. Youth A
was put in handcuffs and taken to her room. Staff 1 and Chief
Administrator stayed with Youth A for over two hours and
debriefed after the incident. She denied witnessing staff choke,
punch, or do anything to hurt Youth A. She did not witness any
injuries on Youth A and Youth A did not report having any injures.
5

Staff 2 was interviewed at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a supervisor and
has been working at the agency for 5 months. Staff 2 was present
for both incidents on 02/28/24 and 02/29/2024. Staff 2 denied staff
punched, choked, or did anything to hurt Youth A. Staff 2 said
Youth A had hit, punched, and attacked staff. Staff 2 said Chief
Administrator called for mechanical restraint due to Youth A’s
aggressive assault on all the staff. Staff 2 reported Youth A had
made threats towards him and other staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 was present for both
incidents involving Youth A being restrained. She said Youth A
was escalated, pulling fire alarms and sprinkler system, messing
with the cameras and assaulting staff. Staff 3 reported staff
attempted to verbally deescalate Youth A, but this was
unsuccessful, therefore Staff 3 attempted a standing restraint,
Youth A broke out of the restraint, so they had to put her in
handcuffs. She said Youth A is over 6 feet tall and bigger than
most of the staff, so she hurt several of the staff members during
both incidents. Staff 3 said 02/29/2024 she was walking with
Youth A to help her calm down and Youth A attacked her by
pulling her and pushing her. Youth A punched Staff 4 in the face
several times and choked Staff 5. She said at no time did staff
choke or hit Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the agency on 04/06/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 denied witnessing
Youth A get choked or punched during the incidents on 02/28/24
and 02/29/24. Staff 4 reported Youth A was punching, hitting, and
choking staff. Staff 4 said staff attempted to verbally deescalate
Youth A, but Youth A was so escalated and aggressive that they
had to use a mechanical restraint to bring safety to the situation.
Staff 4 reported Youth A punched him in the face several times on
02/29/2024. Staff 4 did not observe any injuries or bruises on
Youth A after the incidents.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 05/01/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 5 is the national trainer
and has been working for the agency for 23 years. Staff 5 reported
he spoke with Youth A after she was restrained, and Youth A did
not have any injuries and didn’t want to be examined by the nurse.
He reported he witnessed Youth A hit, punch, kick, and choke
staff. He denied witnessing staff hit or choke Youth A.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Facility policy: Mechanical restraints shall only be
employed as a temporary means of controlling youth
whose behavior poses a demonstrable threat to the
safety of persons or the security or order of the facility,
or for preventing escapes while youth are in non-
secure areas.
• Incident report dated 02/28/2024 written by Staff 1. On
02/28/2024 Youth A was with Staff 1 near the gym. Youth
A became escalated because she was told to stop
playing with the cameras in the hallway. Youth A attacked
staff. A code blue was called. Youth A got into a fighting
stance with fist clinched. Youth A was put in a
mechanical restraint and transported to her room.
• Incident report dated 02/29/2024 written by Staff 1. On
02/29/2024, while in the hallway Youth A grabbed Staff 3
by her braids and when Staff 4 attempted to deescalate
Youth A pinched Staff 4 in the face twice. Staff 4 and
Administrator restrained Youth A in an upper torso
restraint. Youth A continued to kick and assault staff.
Youth A was put in handcuffs and escorted to her room.
• Youth A’s Treatment Plan dated 01/27/2024: Youth A
struggles with controlling themselves and will be provided
with tools that may be utilized to assist with self-
regulations which includes self-monitoring, self-talk, goal
setting and self-reinforcement.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, no
violation is found. Youth A was aggressive and assaulted staff;
therefore, Youth A was restrained. Youth A denied being injured,
having a black eye, or scratches on her neck.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
